title: Nehemiah Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of Nehemiah with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 13 chapters.

questions.question: Who came to Nehemiah in Shushan to inform him about the condition of the Jews in Jerusalem?
questions.explanation: Hanani, one of Nehemiah's brethren, came with certain men of Judah to inform him about the affliction of the Jews and the broken wall of Jerusalem.

questions.question: What was Nehemiah's reaction when he heard about the broken wall and burned gates of Jerusalem?
options: He sat down and wept, mourned, fasted, and prayed
questions.correctAnswer: He sat down and wept, mourned, fasted, and prayed
questions.explanation: Upon hearing the news, Nehemiah mourned deeply and prayed to God for mercy and restoration.

questions.question: In Nehemiah's prayer, what did he confess about the people of Israel?
options: They have dealt corruptly and not kept commandments
questions.correctAnswer: They have dealt corruptly and not kept commandments
questions.explanation: Nehemiah confessed that the people had sinned by not following God's commandments and statutes.

questions.question: According to Nehemiah's prayer, what would God do if the people turned to Him and kept His commandments?
options: Gather them from the uttermost parts of heaven
questions.correctAnswer: Gather them from the uttermost parts of heaven
questions.explanation: God promised to gather His people from wherever they were scattered if they turned back to Him and obeyed His laws.

questions.question: What position did Nehemiah hold in the Persian king's court before returning to Jerusalem?
questions.explanation: Nehemiah was the king's cupbearer, a trusted position in the royal household.

questions.question: Who was the Persian king when Nehemiah made his request to rebuild Jerusalem's wall?
questions.explanation: Nehemiah made his request to King Artaxerxes of Persia to go and rebuild Jerusalem's wall.

questions.question: What was Nehemiah's strategy to inspect the wall of Jerusalem before rebuilding it?
options: He inspected it secretly at night
questions.correctAnswer: He inspected it secretly at night
questions.explanation: Nehemiah went by night to inspect the broken walls and gates to plan the rebuilding.

questions.question: Which group did Nehemiah appoint to guard the work on the wall while building it?
questions.explanation: Nehemiah set people with swords, spears, and bows to guard while others worked on the wall.

questions.question: Who was one of Nehemiah's main adversaries opposing the rebuilding of the wall?
questions.explanation: Sanballat the Horonite was a chief opponent who mocked and tried to hinder the rebuilding efforts.

questions.question: What was Tobiah's role in opposing the rebuilding of Jerusalem's wall?
options: He mocked the Jews and tried to break down the wall
He was a Persian official supporting Nehemiah
questions.correctAnswer: He mocked the Jews and tried to break down the wall
questions.explanation: Tobiah, an Ammonite, mocked the Jews and predicted that a fox could break down their wall.

questions.question: How did Nehemiah respond to the threats and conspiracies against the builders?
options: He prayed to God and set a watch day and night
questions.correctAnswer: He prayed to God and set a watch day and night
questions.explanation: Nehemiah encouraged prayer and vigilance to protect the workers from enemies.

questions.question: What did Nehemiah instruct the workers to do while building the wall to protect themselves?
options: Build the wall farther from the city
questions.explanation: Each worker held a weapon in one hand and worked with the other for protection.

questions.question: How long did it take to finish rebuilding the wall of Jerusalem according to Nehemiah's report?
questions.explanation: The wall was completed in 52 days despite opposition and difficulties.

questions.question: Who was appointed over Jerusalem after the wall was rebuilt?
questions.explanation: Nehemiah appointed his brother Hanani and Hananiah the palace ruler over Jerusalem.

questions.question: What instruction did Nehemiah give regarding the gates of Jerusalem after rebuilding?
options: Leave them open at all times
Do not open gates until the sun is hot and keep them barred
questions.correctAnswer: Do not open gates until the sun is hot and keep them barred
questions.explanation: Nehemiah instructed to keep the gates shut until the sun was hot and appoint guards for safety.

questions.question: Why did Nehemiah gather the nobles, rulers, and people to be reckoned by genealogy?
options: To verify who had returned from captivity
questions.correctAnswer: To verify who had returned from captivity
questions.explanation: Nehemiah sought to identify all the returned exiles for organization and rebuilding.

questions.question: Who was among the leaders that returned with Zerubbabel according to the genealogy list?
questions.explanation: Nehemiah, Jeshua, Azariah, and others led the return from captivity with Zerubbabel.

questions.question: What was the total number of the men of Israel who returned with Zerubbabel and were counted?
questions.explanation: The total number of men was 42,360 according to the census.

questions.question: What was the purpose of the oath that the people took in Nehemiah chapter 10?
options: To walk in God's law and observe commandments
To marry only within their tribes
questions.correctAnswer: To walk in God's law and observe commandments
questions.explanation: They vowed to follow God's law and keep His statutes faithfully.

questions.question: Which practice did the people vow to avoid according to the covenant in Nehemiah 10?
questions.explanation: They agreed not to buy goods sold by the people of the land on the Sabbath.

questions.question: What financial arrangement did the people agree to for the service of the house of God?
options: Paying a third part of a shekel yearly
questions.correctAnswer: Paying a third part of a shekel yearly
questions.explanation: They agreed to charge themselves a yearly tax of a third part of a shekel for temple service.

questions.question: Who was responsible for the wood offering to the house of God according to Nehemiah 10?
options: Priests, Levites, and people by lot
questions.correctAnswer: Priests, Levites, and people by lot
questions.explanation: Lots were cast among priests, Levites, and people to bring wood offerings for the altar.

questions.question: True or False: Nehemiah prayed to God to remember the covenant made with Moses in his prayer.
questions.explanation: Nehemiah reminded God of the covenant made through Moses in his prayer of confession.

questions.question: True or False: Sanballat was friendly and supportive of Nehemiah's rebuilding efforts.
questions.explanation: Sanballat was hostile and mocked the Jews rebuilding the wall.

questions.question: True or False: Nehemiah encouraged the people to be afraid of their enemies and stop the work.
questions.explanation: Nehemiah encouraged them not to fear, but to remember the Lord and fight for their families.

questions.question: True or False: The wall of Jerusalem was completed in just over 50 days despite opposition.
questions.explanation: The wall was finished in 52 days as Nehemiah recorded.

questions.question: True or False: Nehemiah ordered the gates of Jerusalem to be left open at night for easy access.
questions.explanation: Nehemiah ordered the gates to be shut and barred until the sun was hot for security.

questions.question: True or False: Nehemiah appointed his brother Hanani over Jerusalem after the rebuilding.
questions.explanation: Hanani was appointed as a ruler over Jerusalem due to his faithfulness.

questions.question: True or False: The people vowed to give their daughters to the people of the land to foster peace.
questions.explanation: They vowed not to give their daughters to the people of the land nor take their daughters for their sons.

questions.question: True or False: Nehemiah was the son of Hachaliah.
questions.explanation: Nehemiah is identified as the son of Hachaliah at the beginning of the book.

questions.question: True or False: Nehemiah instructed people to lodge within Jerusalem at night for protection while building the wall.
questions.explanation: He told people to lodge in the city to keep watch at night and work by day.

questions.question: True or False: Nehemiah's prayer included asking God to prosper him before the king.
questions.explanation: Nehemiah asked God to grant him mercy in the sight of the king.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Remember, I beseech thee, the word that thou commandedst thy servant Moses, saying, If ye transgress, I will ____ you abroad among the nations:'
questions.explanation: God warned through Moses that if Israel transgressed, He would scatter them among the nations.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'The work is great and large, and we are separated upon the wall, one far from ____.'
questions.explanation: Nehemiah noted the workers were separated on the wall, far from each other.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'So we laboured in the work: and half of them held the spears from the rising of the morning till the ____ appeared.'
questions.explanation: Half the workers held weapons all day from morning till stars appeared at night.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'And I gave my brother Hanani, and Hananiah the ruler of the palace, charge over Jerusalem: for he was a faithful man, and feared God above ____.'
questions.explanation: Hanani was chosen because he feared God above many.

questions.question: Who was the ruler of the palace appointed along with Hanani over Jerusalem?
questions.explanation: Hananiah was appointed ruler of the palace alongside Hanani.

questions.question: What did Nehemiah say would fight for the people if they heard the sound of the trumpet and gathered together?
questions.explanation: Nehemiah encouraged the people that God would fight for them.

questions.question: Which group was NOT listed among those who sealed the covenant in Nehemiah 10?
questions.explanation: Prophets are not mentioned among those who sealed the covenant; priests, Levites, porters, singers, and Nethinims are.

questions.question: What was the attitude of the people toward the rebuilding work according to Nehemiah 4:6?
options: They had a mind to work
questions.correctAnswer: They had a mind to work
questions.explanation: Despite opposition, the people were determined and united in the work.

questions.question: Who sound the trumpet while the builders worked on the wall?
options: A designated trumpet player by Nehemiah
questions.correctAnswer: A designated trumpet player by Nehemiah
questions.explanation: A man sounding the trumpet was present by Nehemiah to signal the people.

questions.question: What was the response of the enemies when they heard the wall was made up and breaches stopped?
options: They were very wroth and conspired to fight
questions.correctAnswer: They were very wroth and conspired to fight
questions.explanation: The enemies conspired together to come and fight Jerusalem to stop the work.

questions.question: Who was the leader that Nehemiah gave charge over Jerusalem after the wall was built due to his faithfulness?
questions.explanation: Hanani, Nehemiah's brother, was appointed because he was a faithful man.

questions.question: What was the city like after the wall and gates were rebuilt according to Nehemiah 7?
options: Large and great but few people and unbuilt houses
questions.correctAnswer: Large and great but few people and unbuilt houses
questions.explanation: The city was large but sparsely populated with houses not built.
